titles.title: Fairness for Disabled Young Adults Act
Fairness for Disabled Young Adults Act
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase the age threshold for eligibility for child's insurance benefits on the basis of disability.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:

This bill expands eligibility for Social Security childâ€™s benefits to include the disabled children of eligible or deceased workers for whom the disability began between ages 22 and 25. (Under current law, such disabled children are eligible for benefits only if their disability began before age 22.)
